title: Mobile Microlearning Program for Mathematics Instructional Design Expertise Development

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: A flexible learning environment accessible via mobile devices for in-service mathematics teachers during daily work routines.

learning_goals: Participants can explain cognitive and strategic thinking processes in mathematics instructional design with 80% accuracy by analyzing expert modeling cases
Through the peer feedback process, evaluate the validity of mathematics instructional design documents three or more times and derive three or more improvement suggestions
Write weekly self-reflection journals to categorize instructional design professional development stages into three or more levels and establish development strategies
Strengthen collaborative competencies by interacting with peer learners (feedback/discussions) at least twice weekly on a digital learning community platform

resources: Mathematics instructional design expert modeling videos (5 episodes)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
